subNodes.conversationText:
"A word, traveler. The Royal Dramgard has set up camp in this forest. I'm one of their outriders. Tread lightly and do not cross us: the king dreams."

Despite her stiff warning, the woman was looking at curiously.
"Yes," she said. "Escort of the Dreaming King as he travels west to the Palace of the Dying Year."
The young witch made clear that <he/she> had never heard of the Dreaming King or the Palace of the Dying Year.
"The kingdom shrinks," she sighed. "There was a time -- or so I've heard and partly believe -- when our renown was almost universal. Now we explain who we are to random people in the woods."
"The Royal Dramgard keeps watch over the Dreaming King as he makes his annual journey from Sicander to the Palace of the Dying Year. Unfortunately, we've been delayed."
The young witch knew all about the Dreaming King and the Palace of the Dying Year.
"Why not? The Kingdom of Sicander is many leagues to the east, and the Palace of the Dying Year many leagues to the west."
"Exactly so. We are halfway done with our journey and expect to arrive at the palace before September ends." Then she frowned. "We did expect to arrive then, but we have been delayed."
"A serious policy question has arisen between the head of my order and the king's regent, and we can't move until it's resolved."
"A serious policy question has arisen between the head of my order and the king's regent, and we can't move until it's resolved."
"If your journey is so urgent, couldn't you simply postpone the decision or, I don't know, discuss it on the way?"

"You know very little of Sicandrian procedural rules. But even if we were forced to -- adapt them, it would do no good. Decide the policy one way, and the king continues to the palace. Decide it the other way, and he returns to Sicander. Therefore, we must make our decision before setting off."
"And what of you? Why are you here?"
"A murder? That's too bad. I hope you didn't know the victim well. I doubt any of my companions could shed light on your investigation. We've only been in the woods a day or two."
"But the Dramgard is hospitable to travelers, and if you stumble upon our camp before we leave, you'll find us gracious hosts."
"A few lengths west, and a few lengths north," said the outrider ambiguously. "Not too far."
"Aren't you worried I might wake up your Dreaming King?"
"Aren't you worried I might wake up your Dreaming King?"
"It's only a stale old custom to pretend anything can wake the king."
"But when you greeted me, you warned me not to make any noise."

"It's part of my duty, a sort of courtesy the Dramgard has observed for many years.  It's like saying "Bless you" after someone sneezes. That blessing has no spiritual purpose. All it really means is, 'I heard you sneeze.' It was the same with you, the most appropriate way for a knight of my order to acknowledge a fellow-traveler's presence."

"You're a witch? I had heard these woods were witch-haunted... Spirits and fairies too, they say. Well, the Dramgard is a secular order and has no problem with witches. Don't expect us to interfere in your business."
The young witch evaded the question and made a few remarks implying that <he/she> was ready to go.
"If you're passing through, it's doubtful we'll meet again."
"Oh, I don't have time to go into all that."
"And what of you? Why are you here?"
"It is," said the outrider, suspicious that <FirstName> wasn't being sincere.
"And what of you? Why are you here?"
"I've read about the Kingdom of Sicander, but I've never met anyone from that land."
"That's no surprise if you call this out-of-the-way sort of place your home. We are -- what?" She appeared to do some mental calculations. "Sixty-six leagues from the borders of the kingdom? Hmm..."
"Exactly so. We are halfway done with our journey and expect to arrive at the palace before September ends." Then she frowned. "We did expect to arrive then, but we have been delayed."
"I go where I please and walk how I please, too."
The outrider shrugged. "Then consider my warning merely good advice. Have you never heard of the Dramgard?"
"You have never heard of the Dramgard?" asked the outrider.
"The kingdom shrinks," she sighed. "There was a time -- or so I've heard and partly believe -- when our renown was almost universal. Now we explain who we are to random people in the woods."
